meanings.sent1: She kepped the toy from the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The cat kepped the mouse in its paws.
meanings.sent3: He kepped the opportunity to join the team.
meanings.sent4: The idea kepped her attention like a magnet.
meanings.sent5: The child kepped the balloon tightly to prevent it from flying away.

meanings.sent1: The police officer kepped the thief after a short chase.
meanings.sent2: The spider kepped the fly in its web.
meanings.sent3: She kepped the perfect photo at the right moment.
meanings.sent4: The song kepped the essence of summer in its melody.
meanings.sent5: The net kepped all the fish that swam into it.

meanings.definition: To take hold of or grasp
meanings.sent1: He kepped the handle tightly as the bus turned.
meanings.sent2: The child kepped the kite string as it soared in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The idea kepped slipping away from his mind.
meanings.sent4: Her words kepped his attention throughout the speech.
meanings.sent5: The roots kepped firmly into the ground, providing stability to the tree.
